content: a bobble i usually started my bobble right as close to when the berry color starts in the cc i did regular double_crochet stitch where the color was green for a leafy effect i opted for a single turning chain to allow for bobbles to be close to the edge of the scarf the size of the hook with this yarn left plenty of room to maneuver the hook into the first stitch for increasing this does mean the first stitch is a little flatter so you ll want to double check your stitch count here and there to make sure you don t miss that flatter stitch at the end of the row you may consider putting a stitch marker in that stitch to remind you to double_crochet into it i place my turning chains at the beginning of the row if you re used to putting them at the end that s fine i included the row counting chart i used to make the pattern increasing and decreasing symmetrical you may find it helpful for row counting i counted down the row then at the half-way point row 77 used the chart from bottom to top once you get the hang of the pattern the chart may be easier to use than the written instructions bobble stitch - dc5tog helpful video for making a bobble stitch https //bit ly/bobble-st note the pattern being worked in the video has single_crochet stitches preceding the bobble garden trellis has double crochet stitches preceding the bobble and one single_crochet stitch proceeding the bobble to bobble begin a regular double_crochet yarn over insert hook into stitch yarn over draw loop back through stitch yarn over pull through 2 loops then stop you will have a half completed double_crochet hanging from your hook repeat the steps 4 more times until you have 5 half completed double_crochet stitches hanging from your hook and 6 loops on your hook yarn over and draw through all 6 loops to complete your bobble always follow your bobble dc5tog with a one single_crochet garden trellis by wendee shulsen www hazelknits com wendee@hazelknits com page 2 instructions foundation set up chain 4 beginning chain at the beginning of the cc light green so the foundation set-up in entirely in the cc row 1 double_crochet in 3rd and 4th chain 2 sts row 2 chain-1 double_crochet in 1st and 2nd sts 2 sts begin increase row - odd numbered row only row 3 chain-1 2dc in 1st st double_crochet in next st 3 sts row 4 chain-1 double_crochet 3 3 sts row 5-20 - repeat row 3 and 4 increasing one stitch on every odd numbered row see accompanying chart begin adding bobbles dc5tog single_crochet on row 6 whenever the yarn color changes to the cc as you please according to pattern notes continue to add bobbles or regular double_crochet througout pattern as yarn color changes from mc to cc row 21 chain-1 2dc in 1st st double_crochet 10 12 sts
